text:
NAEB RADIO NETWORK
14 Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
To: ALL NETWORK MEMBERS
From: NETWORK MANAGER
Re: SUPPLEMENT #5 TO 1ST QUARTER, 1957 OFFERING
Georgetown Radio Forum (56-51)
Program 19 - Issue 6
Topic: CENTURY OF UNITY AFTER CIVIL WAR
Panelists: Col. Robert Selph Henry, author of "The Story of the Confederacy," and
member Board of Directors, Civil War Centennial Association;
Rev, Joseph T. Durkin, S.J., author of "John Dooley, Confederate
Soldier," and "Stephen Mallory, Confederate Navy Chief," professor
of Constitutional History, Georgetown University; member, Board of
Directors, Civil War Centennial Association;
Brig. General Carl A. Baehr, member of the Washington, D. C. Civil
War Round Table.
##*##*####*#####*#*******
Window on the World (56-54)
Program 17 (Issue 8) - "English-American Folksongs" - John Runge, instructor in
physics, is also a professional singer and guitarist who
appears frequently on British radio, television and recital
halls. He is on the faculty of Phillips-Exeter Academy.
New Hampshire, during 1956-57 as an exchange teacher.
Program 18 (Issue 9) - nLand by the Carib Sea" - Edward D, Caffery, Director of
Information and Communications in British Honduras, South
America, He is responsible not only for all broadcasting
which like the BBC is government sponsored, but for the
telephone and telegraph operations in this country.
Program 19 (issue 10) - "You Canâ€™t Bring the Dodo Back" - Peter Scott, a well known
painter of bird life and son of the great Antarctic explorer,
is interviewed by Alan Villiers, the famous clipper ship
sailor. The subject for the interview is the survival
of bird species.
